data.title: Lucas Papademos appointed Greek prime minister - video
data.meta_description: Greece's party leaders agree that Lucas Papademos should head an interim government that will take control of the country until early elections can be held.
data.text:
This article is more than 12 years old

Greece's party leaders agree that Lucas Papademos should head an interim government that will take control of the country until early elections can be held.

Papademos, in his maiden speech, moments after receiving the mandate from the Greek president, says the crisis-hit country is at a crossroads as bankruptcy looms. A former vice-president of the European Central Bank, he adds that although he is not a politician he has devoted most of his professional life to economic policy in Greece and Europe
